Data:
==Applies To==

* iOS applications that handle sensitive data.

==What to Do==

Do not cache sensitive data in temporary files.

==Why==

Data from temporary files may be recovered by an attacker if the device is lost or compromised.

==How==

To prevent caching of sensitive data:

# **Identify sensitive data.** Make a list of all sensitive information handled by your application. Some examples are:
#* Passwords
#* Encryption keys
#* Personal information
# **Identify code that creates temporary files used by the application.** Review the application source code to find functions that are responsible for creating the temporary files. Check if any of these functions write sensitive data.
# **Remove code that writes sensitive data to temporary files.** Edit the functions that write sensitive data to temporary files to prevent caching of sensitive data.

==Privacy Guidelines==
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-0000001a0c7b|Do Not Cache Sensitive Data]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000930b93|Do Not Log Location Data]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-00000033f0db|Do Not Log Sensitive Data]]

==Privacy Checklists==
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-0000008cb7d6|Sensitive Data Is Not Cached]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-0000007e16f2|Location Data Is Not Logged]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-00000058bf53|Sensitive Data Is Not Logged]]
